intro: Schoenus breviculmis, commonly known as the short-stemmed sedge, is a perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, rushes, and grasses. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and swampy areas. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems.
